intro: Myrsine grandifolia, commonly known as the large-leaved myrsine, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, ovate leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature, attracting various bird species. Myrsine grandifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
